show.title: Elf
show.headline: The best way to spread Christmas cheer

event.title: <show-title>Elf</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: With themed games, props, and singing loud for all to hear
event.description:
"Buddy the Elf, what's your favorite color?"

Don’t be a cotton-headed ninnymuggins this holiday season. Come out to Alamo Drafthouse and spread the cheer at this sugar-fueled, interactive holiday spectacular, packed with games, props, and, of course, singing loud for all to hear.

Bundle up for this celebration of one of the best holiday films ever made, period. Will Ferrell’s take on a North Pole elf trying to figure out Manhattan (“Watch out! The yellow ones don’t stop!”) just might be the funniest he’s ever been.

Our ELF Movie Party features all sorts of fun props, a gift "wrap off" before the film, and of course, your very own elf hat.

heroImage.altText: Event Category Web Hero Live QA 1920x1080

show.title: Beetlejuice
show.headline: We dare you to say his name three times

event.title: <show-title>Beetlejuice</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Haunt along with the ghost with the most, babes
event.description:
Betelgeuse, Betelgeuse…BETELGEUSE! Well, we’ve summoned him, guess we might as well throw a Movie Party for him.

BEETLEJUICE is the timeless tale of a ghostly couple and the troublesome “bio-exorcist” they employ to help scare away the living inhabiting their house. It’s megawatt Michael Keaton at his kookiest, Winona Ryder, Alec Baldwin, and Geena Davis at their dreamiest, and vintage Tim Burton from start to finish.

Resurrect the undead fun with spooky props galore and all kinds of delights for the Recently Deceased. This ghoulishly interactive screening comes with Miss Argentina sashes, shrimp keychains, BEETLEJUICE stickers, and even sticky eyeballs. Btw, if you feel an uncontrollable urge to Day-o (the banana song), that’s normal.

show.title: Ghostbusters (1984)
show.headline: Cross the streams into a spectral-blast of fun

event.title: <show-title>Ghostbusters (1984)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Classic movie, interactive props…mass hysteria!
event.description:
For 40 years, GHOSTBUSTERS has held a special place in the hearts of moviegoers with its eye-popping special effects, iconic characters, and, of course, its cast of comedy heavyweights led by Bill Murray. So we want to show our love for this beloved blockbuster by throwing an epically spooky movie party.

We’ll have a bunch of ghostly goodies to help you get in on the fun, including some slime from Slimer himself, some Stay Puft marshmallows, and some glow necklaces you can wave around anytime the Ghostbusters use their proton packs (just don’t cross the streams).

Join us and cheer on Peter, Ray, Egon, and Winston in the fight against the slimy, spooky, supernatural spirits haunting New York City in this hilarious ’80s classic.

show.title: Gremlins
show.headline: Your favorite little monsters invade Christmas, yet again

event.title: <show-title>Gremlins</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Wreak havoc mogwai-style at a fun, interactive screening
event.description:
Joe Dante’s GREMLINS continues to be a pop culture sensation, with its darkly funny story of a small-town guy who receives a furry little creature called a mogwai that ends up multiplying into a swarm of monsters who rip the town to shreds. Frankly, wanton destruction has never been so fun.

At our GREMLINS Movie Party, we won’t let you tear the place apart or ruin our electronics, but we will have all kinds of fun props available to help you get in on the action, including paper plates to throw around during the kitchen fight, and masks so you can choose #TeamSpike or #TeamGizmo.

We just ask that you follow these few simple rules:

  • Don’t get a mogwai wet.
  • Don’t expose a mogwai to bright light.
  • Don’t feed a mogwai after midnight.
  • Don’t miss our GREMLINS Movie Party.

show.title: Shaun of the Dead
show.headline: You've got red on you

event.title: <show-title>Shaun of the Dead</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: How's this for a slice of fried gold?
event.description:
When SHAUN OF THE DEAD first came out, it was instantly recognizable as a cult classic in the making. With its hilariously quotable dialogue, gory action, and genuinely endearing characters, it has inspired a whole genre of ZomRomComs in the intervening years.

So to celebrate the film that launched Simon Pegg, Nick Frost, and Edgar Wright into superstardom, we’re throwing a splat-tacular Movie Party. We'll provide inflatable cricket bats so you can smack your neighbor every time Shaun smacks a zombie onscreen, and your very own Shaun-esque name tag.

While you can’t smoke at Alamo Drafthouse, it’s still a pretty decent place to hole up for a couple of hours and wait for this whole thing to blow over.

show.title: The Rocky Horror Picture Show
show.headline: Do the time warp with us, again

landscapeHeroImage.altText: A53 EGF0 Nz HRG Ku R Itsrt XBM8 FCD

portraitHeroImage.altText: THE ROCKY HORROR PICTURE SHOW portrait

event.title: <show-title>The Rocky Horror Picture Show</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Don’t dream it, be it…at our ROCKY HORROR Movie Party
event.description:
Now, at long last, the antici...pation is over! As the cult of ROCKY HORROR nears its fifth decade, Alamo Drafthouse's celebration of this pioneer of interactive movies has incorporated new breakthroughs, elusive ingredients, and that... SPARK which will make the RHPS experience better than ever!

Now, we know that some ROCKY HORROR screenings can become a little too focused on yelling out those callbacks, so our hosts will make sure we strike a good balance between having some interactive fun while also allowing everyone to enjoy the movie on its own terms.

But we also know that the key to the perfect ROCKY HORROR screening is to have fun and live the movie. With thrilling props (including squirt guns, noisemakers, party hats, inflatable saxophones, and more), the most outrageous callbacks, boisterous sing-alongs, and stimulating pre-show games, our Movie Party will be your ultimate ROCKY HORROR PICTURE SHOW – whether this is your first or 500th viewing.

show.title: Little Bites
show.headline: Monsters are real and there's one downstairs

event.title: <show-title>Little Bites</show-title> <event-type-title>w/Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: Director     Spider One Live in Person
event.description:
LITTLE BITES follows Mindy, a young widow and mother who desperately tries to protect her daughter Alice from the grips of a fiendish, flesh-eating monster named Agyar. Mindy has been secretly sacrificing her own life by allowing the creature to slowly feast on her body as she keeps Alice hidden away at her grandmother’s home.

In-person Q&A with writer/director Spider One

show.title: La Máquina
show.headline: Winning has a price

event.title: <show-title>La Máquina</show-title> <event-type-title>Free Victory Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: See the first episode of the hard-hitting new show early – for free
event.description:
Join us ringside to see Gael García Bernal take on the dark side of boxing before anyone else at our special FREE Advance Screening of the first episode of Hulu’s La Máquina. Reserve your seats today with a small, fully refundable food and beverage voucher you can redeem for snacks and non-alcoholic drinks at the show.

After a devastating loss, Esteban “La Máquina” Osuna (Gael García Bernal) is at a low point in his boxing career. Lucky for him, his manager and best friend Andy Lujan (Diego Luna) is determined to get him back on top. But when a nefarious organization rears its head, the stakes of this rematch become life or death. While struggling to mount a comeback, Esteban must also juggle his own personal demons and protect his family, including his ex-wife Irasema (Eiza González), a journalist who finds herself on a collision course with the dark side of the boxing world.

eventType.title: Free Victory Screening
eventType.headline: Our way of saying thank you to our Victory Members
eventType.description: Calling all Victory Members! We’re saying thanks with a free screening. Just buy a food & beverage voucher to reserve your seat, and then use it toward food and drink at the show.

show.title: Hardcore
show.headline: Another tale of loneliness and obsession from Paul Schrader.

show.title: The Taking of Deborah Logan
show.headline: 10th anniversary of a found footage frightfest

event.title: <show-title>The Taking of Deborah Logan</show-title><event-type-title> with Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline:
Actor     Jill Larson, 
      Co-Writer     Gavin Heffernan Live in Person
event.description:
After months of searching, Mia Medina has found the perfect subject for her PhD thesis film on Alzheimer’s disease. For the next several months, cameras will record the everyday life of mother Deborah Logan and her daughter Sarah. But as the days progress, they observe behaviors and occurrences that show the progression to be far more advanced than anyone was prepared for. What becomes apparent is that there’s something besides Alzheimer’s that has taken control of Deborah’s life. It’s an evil that is far worse than the debilitating disease with which she was first diagnosed. (Shudder)

With star Jill Larson and co-writer Gavin Heffernan live in person

event.description: While we love seeing LEGO® Pharrell tell his story in PIECE BY PIECE, it’s even cooler seeing him tell it live via satellite (in person as a LEGO® brick might be even better, but a lot less likely). That’s why we’re throwing a special Advance Screening of PIECE BY PIECE followed by a livestream Q&A with Pharrell Williams and Morgan Neville.

show.title: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation
show.headline: Nothing but the best for the Griswold Family Christmas

posterImages.altText: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation movie poster

event.title: <show-title>National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Celebrate the season like an honorary Griswold
event.description:
No one knows how to do vacations like the Griswolds. Sure, their holidays are wild, chaotic, and often fraught with peril, but everyone’s family gatherings are a little stressful, aren’t they? Fortunately, you can just let Clark and the gang shoulder all that stress while you enjoy the ride at our CHRISTMAS VACATION Movie Party.

We’re giving it the full Movie Party treatment, with special props like pine tree air fresheners, yellow glow sticks, and ugly neckties to help you feel like you're an honorary Griswold. It’ll be more fun than a membership to the Jelly of the Month Club.

show.title: The Polar Express
show.headline: Journey beyond your imagination in this holiday family favorite

event.title: <show-title>The Polar Express</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: An interactive holiday adventure the whole family will love
event.description:
Tickets, please. You can’t attend THE POLAR EXPRESS Movie Party without your ticket. And believe us when we tell you that the conductor (one of many Tom Hankses in this movie) is very particular about it.

Once you and the kiddos come aboard this special holiday Movie Party, we’ll have all sorts of fun surprises waiting for you, including kid-friendly props like a Santa hat, sleigh bells, and some fun activity sheets for you to take home. (And don’t worry, parents, we’ll be sure to lay down some ground rules so you’re not having to listen to jingle bells the whole time.)

With fun props, tasty treats, and more Tom Hankses than you can shake a candy cane at, THE POLAR EXPRESS Movie Party is a delightful, interactive holiday activity the whole family will love.

show.title: Phantasm
show.headline: See Don Coscarelli's waking nightmare, if you dare

portraitHeroImage.altText: G Id KN3l Hzwlhl P7 VQ4 NR7 H Lpa Iv

event.title: <show-title>Phantasm</show-title>
event.headline: See Don Coscarelli's waking nightmare, if you dare
event.description:
If watching PHANTASM is like experiencing a waking nightmare – strange, unexplainable, gleefully deranged – it's a nightmare you never want to wake up from.

A group of small-town friends must band together to stop the Tall Man, a mysterious force of cosmic horror, and his dimension-hopping schemes as he unleashes his deadly silver Sentinel Spheres among any unlucky enough to enter the boogeyman's mausoleum.

Written, produced, directed, shot, and edited by horror auteur Don Coscarelli when he was only 23 years old, PHANTASM deftly mixes gothic horror, sci-fi, surrealism, and a killer prog rock score together in a grief-ridden adolescent fever dream that horror fans have never stopped worshipping.

Forty years after its release, PHANTASM has never looked or sounded better thanks to a stunning new remaster and a 5.1 surround sound mix produced by J.J. Abrams' Bad Robot and Coscarelli. Don't miss your chance to rediscover one of the scariest films ever unleashed upon the unprepared collective mind of humanity.

DCP courtesy of the American Genre Film Archive and Arrow Video

show.title: In a Lonely Place
show.headline: Humphrey Bogart stars in a noir classic of suspicion, intrigue, and suspense

event.title: <show-title>In a Lonely Place</show-title>
event.headline: Bogart breaks hearts (and noses) in Nicholas Ray’s devastating Hollywood noir
event.description:
We’re all writing the version of ourselves we want people to see. But sometimes, we write ourselves into a corner. It’s “noir season” here at Queer Film Theory 101; as the nights grow longer and the shadows loom large, we’re in the mood for something a bit tormented. In Nicholas Ray’s IN A LONELY PLACE, loosely adapted from Dorothy Hughes's novel, struggling screenwriter Dixon Steele (Humphrey Bogart) is suspected of murder after a brief encounter with a young woman who has turned up dead. Dix’s violent temperament and outsider tendencies certainly fit the “prime suspect” archetype, but he’s got an alibi: his beautiful new neighbor Laurel Gray (Gloria Graham) witnessed the encounter. What follows is a torrid romance that forces Dix and Laurel to question what they know about themselves, and what they’re willing to sacrifice for love and desire.

But is it queer you ask? Absolutely. First off, the protagonist's name is Dix Steele… Bogart’s coldly masculine loner screams repressed homosexuality. The gender roles in IN A LONELY PLACE are consistently in flux, with Steele more often exhibiting the unhinged and manipulative traits of a “femme fatale” rather than the '50s leading man. This twisted noir unpacks the lies that grow between men and women, the falseness of identity in Hollywood, and the darkness that takes hold when we begin to believe the worst of each other and ourselves. WHEW! Something tells us we’re going to need a stiff drink and a long look in the mirror after this torrid classic. Welcome to Hollywood, kid, hope you survive the experience.

show.title: The Brood
show.headline: The ultimate experience in inner terror!

event.title: <show-title>The Brood</show-title>
event.headline: The ultimate experience in inner terror!
event.description:
"THE BROOD is my version of KRAMER VS. KRAMER, but more realistic." – David Cronenberg

It’s spooky season, and that means it’s psychotherapy time…or rather “psychoplasmics” time at Queer Film Theory 101! We’re headed out for a little self-reflection at The Somafree Institute of Psychoplasmatics in David Cronenberg’s most personal and serious film THE BROOD from 1979. It’s MARRIAGE STORY on mescaline!

Developed in the wake of Cronenberg’s difficult divorce, THE BROOD is a startling interrogation into cycles of abuse, patriarchy, and the destruction of the nuclear family, complete with tiny murder goblins! Gorgeous Diva Nola Carveth (the iconic Samantha Eggar) is an unstable and traumatized woman undergoing intense and experimental therapy with Dr. Hal Raglan (Oliver Reed giving stunt daddy realness) at his private institute. As a custody battle between Nola and her ineffectual milquetoast ex-husband Frank (Art Hindle) intensifies, strange murders begin to occur, revealing a terrifying and bizarre manifestation of trauma and rage.

Toxic gender roles, parental failure, and pedophobia (fear of children) are all present in THE BROOD, a movie that posits “maybe heterosexuality is bad?” This gorgeous and provocative melodrama was released to both praise and claims of virulent misogyny and gynophobia, leaving its legacy complicated, but we never shy away from complications here at QFT101! No spoilers, but we’re on the woman’s side. Justice for Nola. These men done did her dirty. Come hang out with us for a night of processing and body horror – if you still want to get married and have kids after watching this movie, that is wild. (Micheal Foulk)

DCP courtesy of Janus Films.

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: Baby Day Show
sessionAttributes.description: For our baby day shows, we keep the lights up a bit, and the sound down a bit, so your little one never has to know they even went to the movies!

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.
